sub_title: Asset Optimisation and Development Manager, EMEA, Lubricants Supply Chain
summary:
15 + years of experience in globally spread upstream and downstream major capital projects, both greenfiels and brownfield developments. Vast experience in delivering front end and execute phase design through contractors.

Highly motivated, reliable, pragmatic engineering professional with broad project engineering, engineering management as well as civil/structural engineering experience. Analytical and strategic taking into account the bigger picture in support of decision making. Strong communication skills with respect for people, valuing diversity and good at relationship building.

Committed to no harm to people or the environment.

courses.name: Shell Project Academy: Essentials of project delivery - Managing Project Definition - Managing Project Execution and Start-up - Masterclass Project Management Framework
Wells Distance Learning Program I & II - accredited at Gordon University Australia

profile_positions.title: Asset Optimisation and Development Manager, Lubricants Supply Chain EMEA

profile_positions.location: Weena, Rotterdam, Shell Downstream Services International BV
profile_positions.title: Regional Engineering Manager ERA, Lubricants Supply Chain

profile_positions.description:
Multi hatting role as project engineer, engineering integrator and civil & structural engineer for the Select and Define phase of the heavy brownfield SWAN (new Solvent Deasphaltising Unit) project in Germany  (100% Shell), ~300mln EUR. 
Technically accountable during the Select and Define phases of the project with Jacobs being the Engineering contractor in Define. 
Engineering integrator 
- Responsible for the site master plan and design philosophies during Select. 
- Responsibility for standards selection and requirements management.
- Responsible for balancing operations and maintenance requirements vs project and engineering requirements (schedule and budget). 

Supporting EM and PM with day to day activities at the contractor engineering office (MOC process, progress reports, schedule and estimate reviews etc).
profile_positions.title: Project engineer - Civil & Structural engineer

profile_positions.description:
Civil & Structural engineer on greenfield Pennsylvania Chemicals Project (100% Shell), >10bln USD. Accountable (as resident engineer in Technip offices in Lyon France) for the detailed design of the Polyethylene units (~1bln USD). PE1-2 design by Linde in Dresden, Germany and PE3 design by Technip in Lyon, France.
Key experience and responsibilities within the project:
•	Resident (Lyon, France) lead civil & structural engineer for PE1-2 (Linde, Germany) and PE3 (Technip, France).
•	Undertook Project Engineering and Project Services role to control and manage the Civil and Structural delivery of the scope, recover the schedule and evaluate the MTO.
•	Build strong relationships with the multiple contractors integrated engineering teams (Europe, India, USA).
•	Build and maintained strong relationships with operations and maintenance teams for incorporation of the assets needs into the design.
•	Driven standardisation (post DG4) across the PE pillars as well as with ECU (ethane cracker) and OSBL.
Key challenges:
•	Balancing construction requests (Bechtel) with design office fixed scope of work by Technip and Linde whilst avoiding and or assessing trends realistically.
•	Managing / aligning the interface between Construction and Detailed Design contractors between whom there is no contractual relationship.
profile_positions.title: Civil & Structural Engineer and Project Engineer

profile_positions.description:
2011-2015:
Civil & Structural engineer on the Al Karaana Petrochemicals Project (20% Shell, 80% QP), <10bln USD. Integrated project with 5 process units (2 MEG plants, OXO alcohol plant, LAO plant and Steam Cracker Unit). Site master planning, site preparation, drainage, infrastructure, buildings (process and non-process), jetty modifications, product offloading systems, insulation, structural design, temporary facilities (35k capacity worker village).
Key experience and responsibilities within the project:
•	Technical Assurance during Select and Define phase.
•	Delivered scope of work for BfD and BDEP Tender packages.
•	Contract holder, Project Manager and technically accountable for the geotechnical and geophysical site investigation in Qatar (1.5 mln USD).
•       Main author of the scope of work for the site preparation contract.
•	Delivered HSSE greenbanding assessment of 4 site preparation contractors. 
•	1 direct report during Sept 2014 till Dec 2014
•	Initiated and executed project change related to product offloading system (loading arms to hose tower)
•	Rewritten the major EPC ITT Scope of Work section related to Temporary Facilities ensuring consistency and alignment within a single ITT package as well as in between the different ITT’s out in the market.

2008-2011
Civil & Marine Engineer, Shell Global Solutions International BV, (Shell Projects & Technology).
•	Lead civil engineer from Select phase upto and including Execution phase of the brownfield refinery projects: Water Pump House 4 rejuvenation (25 mln EUR) and Jetty 32 rebuild (14 mln EUR) projects at the Pernis Refinery in NL,  The Jetty 32 project was awarded the Shell Downstream EMEA 'Project of the Year'  2011 award.
•	Iraq gas export options pre feasibility study (lead civil engineer)
•	Lead marine engineer in Select Phase for Offloading and Export study of Bonga South West / Aparo FPSO project.
•	Author of new DEP for Marine Loading Arms
profile_positions.title: Civil & Structural Engineer
